newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 4 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 4 PM.

text.p: * Parliament's upper house of Senate ratified the friendship treaty between Romania and Hungary. Ruling party senators said the treaty was important to boost the chances of Romania's integration into NATO.
* Lower Chamber of Deputies ended debates and adopted draft law on privatisation of state banks.
* Nicu Ceausescu, 45, youngest son of Romania's late dictator Nicolae Ceausescu, died in a Vienna hospital on Thursday morning of severe liver disease.

* Constitutional Court rejected contests on candidacy in the November 3 presidential polls of Liberal National Alliance candidate Nicolae Manolescu, President Ion Iliescu and Hungarian Democratic Union candidate Gyorgy Frunda. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
